articles.description: Erling Haaland scores a vital winner 19 minutes from time as Manchester City eventually break stubborn Brentford's resistance to close to within a point of the Premier League summit.
articles.title: Haaland gets winner as Man City beat Brentford

articles.description: Luuk de Jong's coolly converted penalty earns PSV Eindhoven a draw against Borussia Dortmund in the first leg of their Champions League last-16 tie.
articles.title: De Jong penalty earns PSV draw with Dortmund

articles.description: Substitute Marko Arnautovic scores to hand Inter Milan the advantage in their Champions League last-16 tie against Atletico Madrid.
articles.title: Arnautovic scores as Inter beat Atletico

articles.description: India rest pace bowler Jasprit Bumrah for the fourth Test against England in Ranchi, starting on Friday.
articles.title: India rest bowler Bumrah for fourth England Test

articles.description: Sir Jim Ratcliffe completes a deal that gives him a 25% stake in Manchester United - worth over £1bn - with the Glazer family retaining a majority stake.
articles.title: Ratcliffe's Man Utd deal finally completed

articles.description: Paris St-Germain and France striker Kylian Mbappe is set to receive a £128m signing-on bonus and earn almost £13m a year.
articles.title: PSG striker Mbappe agrees to join Real

articles.description: Former Germany defender Andreas Brehme, who scored the winning goal in the 1990 World Cup final, dies aged 63.
articles.title: Germany World Cup winner Brehme dies aged 63

articles.description: Andy Murray earns his first win of the 2024 season with a superb performance to beat France's Alexandre Muller in the Qatar Open first round.
articles.title: Qatar Open: Andy Murray beats Alexandre Muller in Doha

articles.description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says forward Diogo Jota faces "months" out with a knee injury he sustained in the win at Brentford on Saturday.
articles.title: Jota faces 'months' out with knee injury - Klopp

articles.description: Marseille sack Italian manager Gennaro Gattuso just five months after his arrival at the Ligue 1 club.
articles.title: Marseille sack manager Gattuso and appoint Gasset
